Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Ioanna T
Reviews.Content: A very cheap hotel (considering the prices in London), the room was quite small and not as clean as someone would expect. The staff was very helpful and friendly.Quiet neighborhood. 2' walking from the metro station(Earl's court-green line)! A good choise if you don't want to spend a lot of money for 3 days in London!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, stale food, mold.....”
Reviews.Author: suze_p123
Reviews.Content: Our experience, at the Lord Jim in Earl's Court, was the worst hotel stay we have ever had. The morning we awoke to bed bugs! The hotel's reaction was "that's what you get when you stay in a hotel- too bad for you". Without other options, we tried another room. No bed bugs in second room. But there was mold all over the bathrooms in both rooms. Breakfast food was stale. Overall, we will never forget our vexing and disgusting stay at the Lord Jim.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average cheap place”
Reviews.Author: SilviaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend not more than two or three days in London, on a budget, Hotel Lord Jim is what you need. It's located at 2 minutes walking from Earl's Court underground station, very convenient for London City sightseeing. Staff is very friendly! The room was small, but actually fitting a double and a single bed. The bathroom was a medium size, small sink but normal shower. The room also had a hair dryer, which surprised me. Carpet all over the hotel make it smell as a usual British place. Was a good surprise to find a lift, as our room was at the third floor (and my luggage was big!). Overall clean, but did not look too much around in details ;) Continental breakfast is included: coffee, tea, juices, bread, croissants, toasted bread, cheese, butter, marmalade and cereals were available at a buffet. We payed 46 pounds each per night during a weekend. Recommended for short staying.

Reviews.Title: “One of worse hotels I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: holidayhappydays
Reviews.Content: We booked by calling the hotel and explaining we need a double room and a triple room with wheel chair access. On arrival we booked in to our "double room" it was more like a single room with a double bed in it... was so small you had to climb in the bed from one side and no room to even put case down to unpack.. awful just awful. After this we checked out the second "disabled room" they told us to get into the lift go to the 3rd floor and then go up the stairs to the fourth floor as the lift only goes to the third. I explained that would be an issue as we had already told them we booked a room with an 84 year old grandparent who was in a wheel chair. After much complaining on their part they placed us in the room on the ground floor by reception, was not great but did the job. We moved our room that night also to a little larger (not better) room, this was by the lift and all you could hear was the lift motor and banging of the door. The lift is not suitable for a wheel chair either, it was like a comedy pushing her into the lift and pressing the button quickly before the door shut then running down to meet her on the ground floor just as some one else pressed for the lift and she was going back up... the lift was SO small. Breakfast was far from interesting, terrible service they spilled milk all over the floor while clearing up (looks like it happens a lot) and we were served bread rolls and cornflakes. The hotel was not clean, I had other peoples hair on my towels and in the bed which made me feel sick and bathroom was dirty, the curtains and nets had holes in. The hotel needs a total refurb.... we will never return everything about this place is shocking.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and very basic, ok for a night or two..”
Reviews.Author: lobstercrumble
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed at the Lord Jim for one night, Nov 2011. The room was what you would expect, small and just basic, telly, kettle and shower. Clean, but pretty worn around the edges. We had a small balcony overlooking the street, which was a bonus as room was quite small (double). Bit noisy on street at night, but what you would expect being so close to Earl's Court Road. The tube was 2 minutes round the corner, which was great for tourists. Breakfast was continental. Not too much to write about but sufficient. Staff were friendly enough. Would recommend for a night or two but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “Fine!”
Reviews.Author: damo36
Reviews.Content: Good for the price. Small room and unfortunate fire alarm at 7am but staff friendly, room clean and breakfast fine.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear”
Reviews.Author: Alex H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I should've enjoyed a short break in London, unfortunately we had booked the Lord Jim, ok at Â£84 for a double room with en-suite in central London it isn't expensive but i would at least expect to be able to go to the toilet without wedging myself between wall and shower door. The room was delapidated and quite obviously designed as a single (with plaster coming off the wall in the outline of a single head board and a single light above the bed) with the double bed shoved up against the radiator. The room was placed adjacent to the managers office and had an awful stench of drains, even though both windows were open when we arrived. Closing them was a chore once we were in as i had to climb across the desk and chair to do it and the windows wouldn't lock, which was an issue as we were on the ground floor. Having asked to see larger alternatives we were handed keys to 2 other rooms, both of which were actually smaller!!! I'm glad i didn't take a cat for i would have had nowhere to swing it! The room had been cleaned and staff were welcoming, but obviously trying to make a silk purse from a sow's ear. Breakfast was a complete none starter there being insufficient room for guests, so avoiding the Lidl cornflakes which apparently constitutes "continental breakfast" we opted to leave early. I hope the next time we visit the nations capital we can find genuine value as opposed to cheap tat, i'm just saddened that travelling tourists from around the globe could find themselves here and believe that Britain has little to offer, especially in the way of accommodation. TBH we wouldv'e been better off staying in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “One night only is enough”
Reviews.Author: speedbrush
Reviews.Content: We were going to Earls Court Arena and wanted an hotel close by as we don,t know London to well . As it was only for one night we decided on Lord Jims , it was reported as a three star we usually go for four stars but as it was ideally situated literally two minutes walk away from the arena we decided it would do us for one night . The room we were given was tiny, the floor boards creaked with every step , the toilet / shower room was the smallest we have ever seen you could sit on the loo and put your feet in the shower tray . There is no way this is a three star hotel we have since seen it on some sites as a two star which is far more accurate . The breakfast was ok nothing special but what was on offer was fine, the small breakfast room was clean and tidy abit like a high street cafe. As a two star for one night it was ok as a three star ? no way ! its saving grace is its close proximity to Earls Court Arena and Earls Court tube station which is at the end of the street would i stay here again ? no, but if your looking for a cheap bed for one night its ok but don,t believe the three star rating its not even close.

Reviews.Title: “We felt welcome, safe, and comfortable here”
Reviews.Author: shabbir154995
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were lucky to find this place to make a last minute reservation after arriving in London and finding the original hotel size was ok for two person and the double bed was very comfortable. I happened to be there during a heatwave, it was all good

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Albert b
Reviews.Content: dont know why there are so many negative comments .This was one of the best place i had stayed in for the price paid . and also most conviniently located around central london . I would definitely recommend this place to stay ......

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda m
Reviews.Content: we stayed in lord jim hotel for 3 nightsin september ,after reading other reviews were bit bothered about staying here .rooms small but very clean ,towels changed every day an they made our bed too toilet an shower very cleanan staff friendly was in great locasion for tube station to get around london would def stayhere again

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug infestation... RUN!”
Reviews.Author: RJ K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Lord Jim for three nights and the second night my fiance woke up at 4am, went to the bathroom and found bed bugs crawling all over her. I awoke to her shriek and turned the lights on to find our room was infested with bedbugs ranging from large ones to tiny red ones. Immediately we packed our things (leaving much of it behind) and ran downstairs to tell the man on the night-shift what happened. He was helpful and pointed us to the closest hotel. This man would turn out to be the only helpful employee at Lord Jim. Prior to this, upon check-in, we were confronted with a rude manager who checked us in after waiting 30 minutes. We had to prepay for the three nights and I'm still harassing them to reimburse me! We stayed 1/2 of a night and payed for 3. Since this is what I would consider a "budget" hotel I wasn't expecting much... the rooms are EXTREMELY small but this can be overlooked, bed bugs cannot. Now that I'm home, I've spent over $100 in dry cleaning, $45 in laundry, thrown out half of our clothes and one suitcase. I'm still trying to be reimbursed for our stay and terrified they followed us home. My advice, RUN AWAY. Find a cheap hotel somewhere else or spend a little more on a better hotel in the area. This place should be shut down! View the pictures to see what you are in store for if you stay at Lord Jim.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL REGRET STAYING HERE!”
Reviews.Author: docabeard
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin....Bed bugs bed bugs bed bugs....Hotel is dirty and the entire place is infested and not to mention VERY NOISY. We were here in August of 2011 for a wedding, and the entire bridal party as well as guest were infected. I highly encourage you to look somewhere else if you are staying in Earl's Court. We booked 5 nights and stayed 4 than moved to the Lily Hotel down the way because they refused to put us up in another hotel prior when I found the bugs. They offered to move us to a different room, in which the following day they said they were going to treat it, and in return the next morning we found more! Now we are left worrying about them entering my home back in the states and I have a 80 dollar dry cleaning bill. At the end of the trip, they reimbursed us for only 3 nights, in which they thought that was fair, but in reality any hotel would have reimbursed them for the entire stay and then some on top. DO NOT STAY HERE....anyone that gives this hotel a good review is probably working for the hotel. This is the first review I have ever given about a hotel, and I was absolutely disgusted. LOOK HERE IF YOU DON'T BELIEVE ME...Bugs in my room and even some other friends rooms!!!!!! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=53YW5eg909g http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pxSCeGRXelU Positive: Good Location If the Lord Jim would like to refund me my entire stay, I will be glad to take down the You Tube Videos

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!! Bed Bugs everywhere”
Reviews.Author: L R
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel stay is the location in Earls Court and distance from the underground... that's where it ends. The second night we woke up to bed bugs crawling all over us. We were moved to two additional rooms. We found bed bugs AGAIN in the third room, even after they claimed they 'treated the rooms with spray'. Not only were our rooms infested, multiple other rooms had the same issue. Now our luggage needs to be thrown out, we've spent over $100 dollars to dry clean and wash all of our clothing, and we still can't be certain they didn't come home with us. Do not stay here until they close the entire hotel, throw out all the mattress and bedding and fumigate and treat the entire hotel. London was a great place to visit, but it is a shame the hotel was able to create such havoc to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovley room, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Saintly-Sin
Reviews.Content: Once again, after reading some bad reviews, I was quite anxious as to what we would find at this hotel. We were visiting London for one night (on a Saturday) to go to the Proud Cabaret and needed somewhere as a base and to sleep the night. We found the Lord Jim in an ideal spot as it is so close to the Earls Court tube station. On first impressions from street view, the hotel looked clean, tidy and very pretty. Check in was not until 2 pm, but we arrived half an hour early with the view that maybe we could sit in the lounge while we wait for them to get the room ready. We did not want to have to carry our bags around London as they were very heavy and the hot weather made it feel like a chore. To our (very pleasant) surprise, we were told that there would be a room available for us immediately. The gentleman that greeted us on reception was very pleasant and enjoyed a joke with us while we checked in. We had booked through lastminute.com (my partner had also contacted the hotel the day before check in to confirm the booking, we would recommend this as there have been issues with bookings taken through that particular site) and requested a double/twin room. On confirming the booking, my partner had requested a double if one is available and was told that the hotel would do their best to accomodate us. We also met with one of the housekeeping staff on the way to our room, she was also friendly and polite, so overall so far, excellent customer service. When we arrived in our room, we found that we had been allocated one of the larger rooms, with two double beds! No complaints there! The room was very clean, the beds were very comfortable and tea and coffee were in abundance. The windows also opened properly, which is a refreshing change. The en-suite bathroom was also very clean and we had been given plenty of towels. The shower is not huge but big enough to have a good shower and the water is lovely and hot. It does take a while to heat up but perseverance is key. On returning from our night out we were let in the hotel and greeted by another friendly chap sitting on reception. The next morning we went down to breakfast, which is in a small room in the basement. Breakfast consisted of tea, coffee and juice, pastries, cereal, yoghurts and fruit and a rack of toast which is handed to you on arrival at breakfast (guests can also request more toast). This was fresh and tasty and did the job that breakfast should do, sets you up for the day. The funny thing about breakfast was that it was the first time during our stay that we had seen or heard any other guests. It is such a lovely and quiet place. At checkout we thanked the staff for a lovely stay and were thanked for our feedback. The gentleman that had checked us in also mentioned how lovely we looked dressed up for the previous night, we thought this was a lovely and personal touch. We would definitely stay in this hotel again and plan to visit London later in the year so fingers crossed for vacancies. This is not a five star hotel but easily offers five star customer service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in London.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: yidarmyKent
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we only booked this hotel for one night, the only good thing was when we checked out! We had a double room/bed, well thats what they said it was! Not enough room to swing a cat, the shower was the smallest ive ever seen & covered in mould. The carpet was so dirty you could feel your shoes sticking to it. Brekkie was ok i guess, but you cant go far wrong with toast, can you? This was by far the worst hotel we have stayed in & we are well travelled, but not fussy.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: karen987654
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in April 2011 for June 2011 for a two night theatre trip to london. The party included myself and two children aged 9 and 14. I had read some bad reviews but thought the pictures looked good and we would be getting a clean, basic hotel. I had also read about rooms not being available when travellers arrived at the hotel and with this in mind went straight to the hotel when we arrived in London at 11am. We were assured our room would be available after 2pm and we left our bags and went to explore London. We arrived back at the hotel at 6pm and our room was now not available!! We were offered 3 single rooms which were not acceptable due to the age of the children, or a double room in the basement with no natural light and overflowing rancid bins of rubbish outside. We had to trawl the streets looking for a hotel to stay in that night. The level of service was non existent and the hotel was obviously dirty and run down. Most normal families would not let their pets stay here. Do not book if you want to be assured that you will have a room when you arrive or if you value you health.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room and good value, but wish the shower/toilet were on the same floor”
Reviews.Author: u03ekw
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a single room for Â£50/night, which is not bad considering how comfortable that room was. The only problem was the toilet/shower which was on the first floor (my room was on the 3rd floor) which may put some female travellers off!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Inexpensive, Convenient, Good”
Reviews.Author: David_The_Blue
Reviews.Content: How you feel about this hotel will largely be determined by how much space you think it adequate in a hotel room. My room was really tight -- just enough room for a bed, small table, and chair. I had to squeeze past the bed to get to the table. The bathroom is really tight too. BUT, it's really convenient to the Earls Court tube station, several pubs, and restaurants. The lounge downstairs is roomy, and a good place to lounge, read the paper, catch up on email, etcetera. WI-FI is free. Everything seems clean. I was only there one night and I didn't spend much time in the room, so it was perfect for what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a short break in London!”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethLuvsLondon
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews about the hotel before l went and wasn't sure what to expect. However, l was pleasantly surprised! The staff were very friendly and welcoming. I paid for a single room with a shared bathroom but was a given an ensuite, so this was an added bonus! Although the room was small, it had everything l needed - towels, tea/coffee making faciiities, hairdryer, phone, nice tv etc. I requested if l could have one of the newly refurbished rooms & they gave me that - so they certainly met the customers needs. The room was nicely decorated, warm and quite cosy actually. Although l didnt have time to eat breakfast (getting up late!) l did see it and although basic, still a variety to choose from. Location was great to, its literally just round the corner from Earls Court tube station and the hotels on a nice, quiet street. The high street also had some good shops/pubs. The only small negative thing l would say is that the lift was broken so we had to walk up 4 flights of stairs to our room, however l wasn't too bothered about this. Overall, a friendly, good-value for money hotel - l would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ageorgiou
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute business trip to London and booked the Lord Jim Hotel because of the good location. The staff were very friendly, my room was also upgraded free of charge when I arrived. The hotel was very clean and in a very convinient location close to the restaurants and Tube stations. Great Value for money will defenately stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Little Gem Lord Jim”
Reviews.Author: misslittletraveller
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Lord Jim and was greeted warmly. The receptionist tried to upgrade my room since I was female and had decided to share a bathroom but unfortunately there wasn't a room available for 3 nights. It was a nice gesture and I was happy to share a bathroom since this is what I had booked regardless. I paid a mere Â£40 a night which for the location is quite a bargain, it is literally a two minute walk from Earls Court & tube station and it's in Kensington which is a lovely area. There are a lot of reviews moaning about the size of rooms and so forth. Yes it was small but this is London and if it is cheap it is also going to be small. Also these are characteristic town houses that have been turned into bed and breakfasts in a affluent area, so I believe it's part of it's charm personally. The room was clean, there were nice little extras (shampoo, conditioner, soap) and everything I needed for my stay. The room was always cleaned nicely after I came back with even my own stuff I'd left around tidied up when I got back. The room was also nice and warm and generally I found the hotel appealing to look at including a very pretty outside and lobby. They were putting decorations up for Christmas in the living room which was also nice. The breakfast was nice and the toast was served fast every morning. Nice choices such a fresh fruit, yoghurts, cheese, pastries and the juice was always nice and cold. I enjoyed staying here and will be staying for a week again. For London it is a great little hotel with a great price and a service and little extras I think are great for the price. If I ever want to stay in a hotel in London I will most likely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i ever stayed at... avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: kit123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Lord Jim hotel, i can honestly say this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. We had booked for 2nights and had to pay up front without seeing the room. The room was incredibly small, the toilet/shower was in a cupboard, the whole room cleanliness was sub-standard., but the worst bit was the bed had bugs in it. we left the next morning,without any breakfast ( i didnt want to think about the hygiene) or refund, just an offer of an alternative room!! which i am sure was equally as bad.

Reviews.Title: “FRAUD - Stolen Money! - Kreditkarten-BetrÃ¼ger!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0119
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at the Lord Jim Hotel via Booking.com in July 2010. However, my credit card has not been accepted. IÂ´ve e-mailed several times to the hotel to ask whatÂ´s exactly wrong with my credit card but didnÂ´t receive an answer at all. So eventually I had to cancel again. Which I did, of course within the free cancellation time. After spinding my time in London at another hotel and returning home, I discovered my credit card being charged 70 GBP by the Lord Jim Hotel! A WONDER had happened!!! Suddenly, when it came to paying a cancellation fee, which I obviously didnÂ´t have to because it was an error, my credit card worked again! Oh Miracle!!! I contacted the Hotel and also Booking.com immediately. They told me that was an error by the hotel and the issue would be solved the same day. Well, that was already a month ago. IÂ´m still calling them 3 times a week to find out when IÂ´m gonna get my money back eventually. And they keep promising me to call me back as soon as the person in charge is available. For me the case is clear: LORD JIM HOTEL CHEATS and is engaged in CREDIT CARD FRAUD

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but tiny, smelly room”
Reviews.Author: WheelyBag
Reviews.Content: For someone who is literally going to only sleep in their hotel room, the Lord Jim is alright. There was no room to put my suitcase, so I was constantly stumbling over it. The bathroom sink was next to my bed (not too bad I suppose, but cramped) and the bathroom smelled to high heaven from mould/mildew, but was very clean nonetheless. The room also got extremely hot (I was there in Summer) to the point where I couldn't sleep comfortably. This was despite it being 10 degrees cooler outside. I had to also wear earplugs as I could hear the person in the next room cough - that's how cramped it is. All in all, an underwhelming experience, but that's London hotels for you!

Reviews.Title: “central location, rooms small, staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: LondonMags40
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hotel with friends for the weekend, the hotel is well located near to shops, bars underground etc. The rooms are very small and basic, breakfast is poor compared to previous basic hotels I have stayed in. The night receptionist (Omar) was very helpful assistng us with room problems and general assistance, he was working alone, and had to deal with many customers problems, which I thought was very unfair. I imagine the owners don't really care as long as the hotel is full. If you want somewhere reasonably cheap and cheerful this hotel is ok for a base for a few nights but thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, worst hotel I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: JamieEdin
Reviews.Content: I only paid Â£40 for one night at this hotel so wasn't really expecting much...but never imagined it would be quite so bad! The worst thing about it by far was the absurdly small room: about 4ft by 12ft. Was barely room to get in, get dressed etc. Second worst thing was the toilet which was filthy. I thought that they might redeem themselves with a good breakfast...I was wrong. The breakfast choice is orange juice, cornflakes, branflakes, cheap white toast, cheap rolls, cheese slices, croissant and fruit. (I stayed at a Â£45 hotel the next night and got a good English breakfast.) The kitchen seemed understaffed as I had to wait a long time for my cutlery while other people had to wait a while for a seat. The only positive thing about the hotel is the price but my advice is to pay an extra Â£10-20 and go somewhere half-decent.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better...”
Reviews.Author: OzOwen
Reviews.Content: Only stayed the 1 night here and it wasn't a great experience. When I arrived the guy on the desk had so much attitude and was downright rude. He deliberately made me wait for not apparent reason. If it hadn't been so late at night and cold I probably would of thumped him one and gone elsewhere. and I'm not the violent type! but he was just so rude and arrogant. The room itself was so tiny I've seen bigger coffins. The TV was tiny and reception was poor at best. The bathroom (to continue the theme) was also tiny. Though it was clean. I found the hotel to be noisy and i didn't sleep well. I was up early and gone the next morning. Not a great experience. The only positive was that there was coffee & tea making facilities in the room. Even if I had to rinse the jug 5 times to get the slime out of it.For anyone wanting to stay in the Earls Court area I recommend the London Town Hotel in the same street as the Lord Jim. Bigger rooms, better service and cheaper. To the manager, get rid of the tosser on the front desk and reduce your rates to reflect the small nature of your rooms. (Ive stayed in about 10 hotels in London and that was the smallest I'd seen)

Reviews.Title: “The single worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: IltellYouWhenIfindIt
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Be advised to be very careful and remember if you ever decide to stay here there will be a huge disappointment. Rooms are so small that you can barely fit in. there is no space to turn around. There is no bathroom or toilet in the room.There is only one shower and toilet for a entire floor. Rooms are dirty and old. Bit smelly too. Breakfast is served in very small room. If you get to breakfast every time something is missing â€“ milk, coffee, cups, bowls. I had to wait for like 30 minutes to get to the table. After 11:00pm you can to even buy a soft drinks form vending machine, because they close the doors to this room. Service is also terrible and rude. It is just not worth it to save few pounds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: potgirl60
Reviews.Content: We were offered a tiny ,dirty room.with electric kettle that didn't work. Icomplained and we were offered another just as tiny and only slightly cleaner, We had one cup for 2 people. Everyday the cups were removed and we had to ask for them at reception.Room was smelly. Breakfast room ran out of milk, cereal bowls. Not enough tables to accommodate all guests. The only positive was the bathroom,clean with good shower and plenty of hot water. The experience overall was depressing. Is this a Best Western Hotel? From the net I had the impression that it was, but if so standards have fallen badly.

Reviews.Title: “Terible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JeanC_10
Reviews.Content: I had booked a 3 nights' stay at the hotel on 17 Mar. Despite given confirmation number FUN763106iJTLORD, my family of 5 were unable to check-in on our arrival. Mr Khaleed from the reception told us that we are not expected and suggested that we should look elsewhere for a hotel. I was amaze that how did they even get listed in the visitlondon website. NEVER book with this hotel again and Lord Jim Hotel does not even deserve any star or list in the any tourism board website.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: LuAnnH3
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small as expected in London with minimal closet space. The staff were polite and accomodating and the breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but cramped”
Reviews.Author: torpern
Reviews.Content: Hotel nearby Earls Court tube station. Small twin room en suite, just barely space for 2 suitcases. Small is also the operative word for the breakfast room. Seemed a little bit too small around 8.30 - 9.00. I was satisfied with the cleaning of our room during our stay. But when we left I lifted the beds to see if we had dropped anything under them. It did not look like it had been cleaned in quite a while. The location is good though with many good restaurants and pubs in the area. All in all a hotel I would not bring the family, but for a football and pub trip with the guys; it's quite OK.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lord Jim / Bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineVestlandet
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lord Jim has a standard far below what we expected. The rooms were tiny, dirty, smelly and the staff were not polite or nice. We intended to stay for four nights but left after one night.. We were not alone in our room, our beds were also a place for bed bugs. The manager didnt see this as a problem , for us it was a big one. Find any other hotel , dont stay at Lord Jim.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: puffNorway
Reviews.Content: We came to stay early october and found rooms so small we could hardly fit in our suitcases, not like the pictures at all. But it was getting worse, far worse, the rooms had bedbugs. We left the hotel the next morning and found another one. The state of the rooms were below any standard. The worst was that the management did not see the bedbugs as a problem. They should take the problem seriously and clean out this filthy hotel. Who wants to wake up with the bed full of bloodstains from the hungry bugs???! Disgusting! Do not stay at Lord Jim!

Reviews.Title: “One large advantage - very good location”
Reviews.Author: Forsait1979
Reviews.Content: Only one reason if you wish to choose this hotel â€“ very convenient location/arrangement. The metro station (Earl's Court Station) is located in 1 minute of walking from hotel; this branch line connects directly to Heathrow and to the centre too. Itâ€™s the beautiful and well-known area Kensington. There are a lot of shops, pubs, the cafe Internet - and so forth. Itâ€™s simply pleasant area. Hotel very poor inside, at enough high prices even for 2 stars hotel. Class rooms Â«single with a showerÂ» tiny, all furniture are very old, a bath is not too pure, itâ€™s very noisy all night long (at least for those who receives numbers on 1 or 2 floors). A breakfast is poor. The basic disadvantages â€“ itâ€™s not enough area/place, the old age, dirtiness, noise. I donâ€™t approach for family rest and/or rest with children, only for young people/students or the people travelling on affairs of business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pianodeb
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Lord Jim two different times during our stay in London and we were very pleased. The staff was very accomedating. In fact on our return to London we were to stay at a hotel across the street and they didn't have a room for us and the Lord Jim set us up with rooms on short notice. The gentleman that worked at the front desk went out of his way to help us,. Everyone helped us out . The rooms were small but comfortable and very nice and clean. I would recomend this hotel to anyone. It was also close to shopping and the tube.Thanks especially to the young gentleman that spoke six or so languages!! Deb & Deni

Reviews.Title: “School Trip”
Reviews.Author: sharks28
Reviews.Content: Lord Jim's ist practical for people who'll stay for two or three days at London. The most terrible breakfast I ever had was there, so everyone should take a look for the next bakery. I can't complain about the rooms, they were clean and big. We just had to look for the light switch, who was in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: tomstomst
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel and have been to three hotels in the area, but this was the most disappointing one. Incredibly cramped rooms for not a small price, daytime staff was impudent, don't count on the wifi actually working and most time it will be very slow. There are other choices out there (at least fifteen hotels in the same street) and if you look ahead of time you're very likely to find something much more appeasing that this. I have.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: NicolaC_9
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the Lord Jim was great. We had a nice room, they are small rooms as all hotels in London are but I wouldn't say it was cramped although the bathroom was definitely compact - fully functional though. The staff were extremely helpful, especially in the morning. It was the day of the tube stikes and they were keeping up to date with line information and gave excellent advice on how to complete my journey to work. If you're looking for a nice hotel and a great price in London that's literally round the corner from the tube station then this is a great place to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Average hostel”
Reviews.Author: Dmok
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel in late March, it is very very close to tube, can reach the tube within 2 minutes, and there are many fastfood restaurant for selection (Such as KFC, Burger King (recently renovated due to rat problem), McDonald, Sub-way and so on). There is also free wifi. Yet the room is extremely small, not enough to have a luggage box fully opened. There is also a strong smell of mold from the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsItchyFeet
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Lord Jim as a week end away birthday treat for my daughter's 25th birthday. Initially, I had mixed feelings after reading reviews and with hindsight, I should have heeded them. The hotel photos look cosy and inviting and great value for money, but this was not our experience. On arrival, the male receptionist was very courteous and pleasant and checked us in speedily as we were loaded with bags etc. we were given our key and room number, but not directed to it's whereabouts. We found it, It was broom cupboard no.3 behind reception at the front of the hotel. I had booked a twin room, as I didn't think my grown up daughter would want to 'share with mummy', but she had no choice as it was a double bed not twin, and the hotel had no other rooms available. We laughed it off and decided to make the most of our cupboard. We went out for a meal, as there are a good selection of reastaurants, bars and cafes all within 2 minutes walking distance of the hotel. Returned to our room at 10pm and were unable to watch tv as it is a flat screen high on the wall above the bathroom door, however, you could see the picture if you stood by the window! We were unable to get to sleep because of the high level of noise (laughing, screaming, shouting etc) coming from the room below us, I finally reported this to reception at midnight. The same receptionist from earlier said he would sort it and advised me to call from our room if I needed him again. By 3am, still noisy and still no sleep, I tried to call reception and the phone didn't work! Back to reception in my PJ's, again I reported the noise from below our room, again I was told it would be sorted. No apology was received at either time. The noise still continued. Finally got to sleep somewhere about 4am, so if you are a nightowl, or out most of the night, this shouldn't be a problem. However, if you need to sleep in, this isn't possible either due to traffic noise, doors slamming around the hotel etc. Breakfast was basic, but fresh......O.J, toast, croissants, cereal, fruit bowl, coffee was excellent - something needed to be be! On checking out, met another male receptionist who was also courteous and polite and let us leave our luggage at the hotel to be collected later.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ahaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in triple room.Small but clean,bathroom very small but clean and nice hot shower.People complaining about breakfast most probably not used to anything better at home,we enjoyed a good breakfast every morning.Will go back in future and recommend to friends,good value for money

Reviews.Title: “It wasnt as bad as I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: Polly05
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too keen on going to this place after reading the reviews on here, but the others I was going to london with, were fine with it, so it was booked. It wasn't as bad as I was expecting. The room seemed clean enough, and I didn't see any beasties. The room and bathroom were small. And the room was very hot. We arrived late in the evening, in December, and when we entered our room, it was roasting hot. And that was with the window open. We closed the window to keep the beasties out and went out for something to eat. The next day, the heat in the room didn't seem so bad... Overall, it was OK. But I wouldn't book it again, incase I wasn't so lucky next time and got a different room that wasn't as nice...

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasmineMarti
Reviews.Content: I ended up at the Lord Jim Hotel quite by accident when The Cromwell Hotel had overbooked me and made arrangements to send me to the Lord Jim. The French receptionist, I wish I knew his name, was absolutely terrific and comforting. The room and bathroom were pretty decent, but plain. The bathroom did not have a bathtub, just a shower. The hotel is pretty close to the Earls Court Tube stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lel_8
Reviews.Content: The front entry and the common room (tv, internet, coffee/tea room) are very well presented & inviting. Very obliging & friendly staff member at reception on our arrival day allowed us to check into our room very early rather than the usual 2pm. Our triple room was very small even for London's standard. I was expecting small but this was much worse & quite dark & drabby. First things first after a long night on a plane...a shower, which proceeded to backup..blocked drain! Advised staff, went out for breakfast, on our return we're moved to an even smaller room! This was on the very top floor & was more like an attic room with positively no room to move. I'm sure it was a storage room before they decided to throw some beds in it. I requested a better room, stated we were prepared to pay more but nothing avail. The linen was of very poor standard (old prickly blankets) Terrible ventilation, quite stuffy, like sleeping in a wardrobe! Accomodation incl. breakfast which was very much below standard. Cereal, juice, foul coffee, cold tea, one only choice of fruit (orange) for the entire 4 sittings we had. Plastic cheese, no cold meat, no eggs. But they did bring to your table fresh toast & jam. Of course location is excellent...just around the corner from tube & buses. At $800 + Australian dollars for the 4 nights, I expected better accomodation. I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay and excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Alcym
Reviews.Content: Once a year I go to London on holidays. This was the first time I went with my parents and my sister and we really enjoy the stay in the hotel. We booked a quad room via internet and everybody was so happy with the price and the place! The hotel is located in Earls Court, two minutes walking from the tube and easy to find and there are a lot of restaurants and several supermarkets around. The room was not very big but itÂ´s normal when there are 4 people with 4 suitcases, handbags and everybody clothes around. The bedding was ok, there was a small tv, a hair-dryer and a kettle for tea and coffee and almost every day we had clean towels... Everything was clean, the commune areas, the dinning room, our own room and the inside bathroom... We specially enjoy the breakfast. You could have cereals, toasts, buns and croissants, coffee, two different sort of juices and fresh fruit! The receptionists were so friendly. Every day after our journey around the city they ask where did we go, what we are going to do the next day, they even recommend us more places to go! The unique inconvenient we had was the first night we stay, the water tanker was a little bit noisy because it was flowing water but in the morning I told one of the receptionist and when we came back the problem was sorted out. On November I am planning another trip to London with my boyfriend, so if they can give me a good price I will go there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Lord Jim”
Reviews.Author: arivard
Reviews.Content: For a european hotel, I can't complain about the Lord Jim. If you need a huge space to lounge around this is not the place for you, but if you're going to be sightseeing and not spending much time in the room, its close and convenient to a tube station, clean and has a standard european breakfast. The price is average for the area and not one to complain about, especially so close to central london.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: queenie60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke. We got to the hotel early and were allowed to leave our bags. We returned at the time to chcek in only to be told they had no rooms? A complete lack of organisation and very suspiscious. We were told the previous occupants had not checked out so we could not have the room. Surely, we have priority over the room we booked for that night? We had no choice but to stay in a hotel opposite after spending hours searching for a suitable hotel in the first place. Very disappointed and could have potentially ruined our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “just to get your head down...”
Reviews.Author: bradermonk
Reviews.Content: We were going to a wedding in shepherds bush and were looking for something nearby that was a little cheaper then the Â£80 chain hotels in the area. The Lord Jim was just Â£50 for a double room ...bargain. For that price and such a decent location (few steps away from earls court tube) there had to something wrong right? ...well, the rooms were tiny ... but we just didn't find this a problem in our circumstances. It was clean, good service, bathroom small but fine, great brekkie as part of price, didn't mind our late check in ... and as somewhere to just sleep... perfik. If you're a large space snob ...steer clear ...if you're willing to compromise space for a Â£30 discount. Book.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: papa-rupe
Reviews.Content: Okay the decorating leaves a bit to be desired and the rooms are small ... but be reasonable. This is a budget hotel that delivers comfortable beds, hot showers and breakfast inclusive rates. I had room 2. It was tiny, but at the back so quiet. Fresh, crisp sheets, 24 hour reception (in London for a party) and friendly breakfast staff with fresh toast. Nice guy on reception too. Would I go back - yes.

Reviews.Title: “loved the lord jim”
Reviews.Author: jane24
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely weekend in the lord jim. it is a lovely clean hotel with good service from all members of staff. room was small but had all we needed. location excellent. facilties good with tea making, television, phone, hairdryer and clean towels and complimentary toiletries. breakfast was toast, croissants, juice, fresh fruit, tea coffee and cereal. we would recommend it for a stay in london

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: KSZ
Reviews.Content: I was a bit uneasy during booking cause I had read several negative reviews about this hotel on the net but I had very limited time left and honestly had no much other choice to make so I booked online and went. I have stayed there for a week and can say that it was much better than I have expected . First the positive sides: The location is in a very close walking distance to tube station (Earls Court) and is in a convenient,safe area. There are several eating places (fast food /rest /cafe )and supermarkets around in case you need. The bathroom was very small but it was quite new&clean. The room/bed was also clean.The towels were provided and though not everyday,they were changed from time to time. As to negative sides: The room is really small-not much place to place your stuff and even walk. Sheets were not changed during this one week. The street where the hotel is located,can be sometimes noisy at nights (other many hotels and people around) and since in warm weathers the window is open, this may be a bit distrubing at nights.Similary if the people in the hotel are the noisy and "door-banging" types,you may hear those as well. The breakfast hours were quite early (7:30-9:00) and the breakfast room was very small.In order to find a place, you had to go quite early-which was not very preferable for me after walking all day in the city. One other thing ,before going there I had sent an e-mail to the hotel to confirm my booking and had no reply from them at all -which I found unprofessional. Anyway, I think that from this level hotels (2-3 stars/ b&b) in London ,you shouldn't expect much. Yes,they are pricy (compared to the service) but still can't be compared with global standards. Therefore if it is clean and central that should be ok -at least that was all my expectation and I can say that Lord Jim was quite ok in that sense. However if you are looking for some more quality and comfort I'd suggest to go for at least 4-star hotels. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness needs great improvement”
Reviews.Author: Bekki830
Reviews.Content: The location & price is why I chose this hotel. Located at Earls Court Tube Station(3mins walk) is along the Piccadilly Line(=direct line to Heathrow) and among the few stations that has handicap access(=with elevators=luggage friendly). View from room window is of quiet tree-lined neighbourhood(not bad!). Hotel has a tiny lift to most floors(=luggage friendly). Room and toilet is very small. The room itself seemed ok at first look with new wallpaper & new bathroom fittings. But the cleaniness was horrible. The toilet walls and door are smeared with toothpaste???, fingersmudges and other ??? stuffs. The shower cubicle's floor and the wash basin were slimy. Shower very weak. The bed-linen was moldy when bedcover and blanket was pulled away coz rather warm and w/o air-conditioning in room. The phone and remote control were sticky with orange juice or sth. Cleaniness is the most important factor when choosing a hotel. I sincerely hope they can improve as their other factors are not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Natural History Museum”
Reviews.Author: Treefern3
Reviews.Content: Location is great, hotel terrible. Booked a room for five for three nights. When we arrived we were told this room was out of action-even though I had phoned on the morning to check arrangements. Told we had to have two rooms. Our children are only young-so this was a total inconvenience. One room reasonable, the other had a really unpleasant smell. After moving a set of drawers found a mouse poison trap. Hence the smell. Moved us after complain after one night. Windows opened fully onto a three storey drop-so we had to suffer the smell, or risk death by falling. Had paid up front so no recourse.

Reviews.Title: “Concert convenience”
Reviews.Author: TheAssessor
Reviews.Content: Bearing in mind recent reviews went with some trepidation. Should not have worried, excellent location to the Earls Court tube station and the Centre. Receptionist pleasant and check in/out was smooth. Room was bijou, but warm and clean with great shower. Breakfast was absolutely fine with efficient service (quick tip get in close to 8am rather than 8.30 when it gets very busy, as room is small) Overall a no frills, positive experience which was excellent value made better by a magnificent performance from George Michael..

Reviews.Title: “Be very wary of this place!”
Reviews.Author: Casper_The_Great
Reviews.Content: Warning, stay away from this hotel!. I booked on travelstay(-) for a single room in July. When I turned up at the Lord Jim reception I was told that I was actually booked in to another hotel owned by the same people. So I walked to the Court Hotel on Earls Court Road and found it to be a door with a shabby awning over it between two shops. When I checked in my room was tiny, but clean and comfortable apart from the noisy road and a window that didn't close properly. Needless to say I didn't get much sleep because of sirens and other traffic noise. There was a sink in the room with a hot water unit on the wall but with no tap coming from it so actually no use. One of the communal showers was also broken. In the morning was the worst part though, I went down for breakfast expecting the continental breakfast promised at the Lord Jim. Instead I was faced with a "do-it-yourself" kitchen where there was white bread for toast and margarine and jam on the table. To make things worse there was hair in the margarine. The "chioce" of drinks was instant coffee or tea bags. As I don't eat white bread I was unable to eat breakfast at the hotel. Guests were also expected to wash their own dishes after they had used them! Even if brown bread had been on offer I doubt I would have eaten in that kitchen at all. So if you so book to stay at the Lord Jim Hotel but are told when you arrive that you are actually staying in the Court Hotel don't go there. Fight for the room you have booked in the Lord Jim on the quiet side road with a full continental breakfast. I found out later that the Court Hotel is infact registered as a hostel, not a 2* hotel. This is called misrepresentation and is illegal. I paid to stay in a 2* hotel and ended up in a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Home, sweet closet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Lord Jim's last summer. We would not stay there again. We called it "home, sweet closet" for four days. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The only way to reach the sink was by sitting on the end of the bed. My dad's knees hit the bathroom door when he sat on the toilet. It has to be admitted, though, that the breakfast was very good. We loved the tea. But it's London; you can find good tea somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal and Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: kaddee
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lord Jim was everything we expected and hoped for in a hotel of this class. We live in Europe and are frequent global travelers and London is a favorite destination of ours. We've stayed in places that were a disgarce compared to the Lord Jim, paying more for a room and dealt with rude, incompetent staff, unclean rooms, etc at some of those other places- the Central Park Hotel in Bayswater comes to mind- (It was awful)...but not so at the Lord Jim! The experience with this hotel and its convenient location was pleasant and a GREAT deal for the money. True, the breakfast room is small, but we surmounted that in part by arriving as early as possible, for one thing. More of a problem was that when we arrived each day, some of the guests were reluctant or refused to share open seating at the communal tables with folks they didn't know. For instance, virtually every time we went to breakfast, there would be 1 or 2 people taking up a table with 4 seats, and much grumbling if we asked if we could use their available, unused seats. Come on, it won't kill anyone to share a table with strangers for a half hour or so. People sit next to strangers at lunch and cafe/bar counters all of the time, don't they? And though the breakfast spread would not rival that of the Ritz Carlton, it was certainly of an adequate quality. Coffee, tea, juice, rolls, croissants, creals, hard boiled eggs, toast, jam, butter and fruit, exactly what I'd expect at a hotel in this class. The breakfast room staff stayed right on top of things and were quite accommodating. Our double-bedded room was very small, but we expected that as well for this hotel category- it was clean, well-provisioned, and comfortable. That's all we require, especially since we're not even in our hotel room most of the time while touring. But it makes it that much nicer when the room you return to after a day of sightseeing and exploring is cozy and clean. Our room there was always clean and well-kept.. The LJ is located on a lovely, quiet street. The staff in the reception area were always friendly, patient and helpful during the course of our stay. There is Internet service in the vicinity of the reception area, as well as snack vending machines. Continental breakfast was included with room price. A big plus is the close proximity to the Earl's Court tube station- just a short stroll away, and also there are quite a few shops, pubs and eateries nearby. We wouldn't hesitate to book at the Lord Jim again, it passed all of our expectations for the price range and we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had previously read some bad reviews on this website and was worried what my stay would be like. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. Our family room was ample size. The accommodation was basic but that was what we paid for. The room was clean and all the facilities described were available. We were provided with clean towels each day and the bathroom was also cleaned daily. Staying at the Lord Jim made our first stay in London as a family very enjoyable and we would definitely stay there again. The location was excellent for travel around London.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay at the Lord Jim again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 25 college and faculty to London for spring break and we stayed at the Lord Jim for five nights. Our experience there was perfectly acceptable. Be prepared for small rooms, but that's London. They were a bit traveler worn, but exceptionally clean. Most significantly, most of the staff members are clearly "first class" in their friendliness and concern about our stay---in fact, the service staff is above average compared to the majority of hotels I have stayed in the U.S. and I have traveled quite a bit. Omar and Pascal, evening staff, were especially helpful. The breakfast was plentiful. We felt very safe in the Earl's Court area and the Lord Jim is just around the corner from the Piccadilly, District and Circle Lines. Overall, we had a positive stay and I would stay there again. Anneliese from the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about it. Had the misfortune to stay there on a recent business trip. No hot water in the morning, no apology and no decrease on bill. All in all a truly miserable experience. Plenty of other good hotels in the area. Don't stay at the Lord Jim!

HotelInfo.Name: Lord Jim Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 23-25 Penywern Road | Earls Court, London SW5 9TT, England
